results.title: Are we really doing well?
results.brief_description: Examines the services provided by the management consultant company Inter-Firm Comparison Service and their different approaches to helping small business proprietors in the areas of efficiency, profitability, flexibility and industrial and public relations. No other credits available.

results.title: Are we doing enough about retirement?
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC 24 Hours”.
To many people retirement comes as a shock and leaves a vacuum in their lives which is all too often filled with worries about their health. An association in Birmingham which tries to help people enjoy their retired years, and a workshop where people work half time shifts in an attempt to improve the situation. No other credits available.

results.title: Are there any questions?
results.creator_credit: James Parker, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A recruiting film, filmed on location at the RAAF Base, Amberley, Queensland, promoting the role of the RAAF Shows the air force as a worthwhile employer of people in an extremely wide range of occupations, ranging from the unskilled to the highly technical.

results.title: Are people sheep?
results.creator_credit: Julian Biggs, Grant McLean and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Discusses social conformity, citing everyday incidents as examples of obedience to custom in present day society - the little boy who felt his birthday gift would not be liked because it was different; the housewife who flew into a frenzy of tidying up when the door-bell rang; the teenage daughter who believed she must adopt behaviour beyond her years in order to be accepted. The film concludes with an interview with Dr Brock Chisholm, psychiatrist and former head of the World Health Organization, who comments on the importance to our society of the visionary who looks beyond the confines of convention.

results.title: Are my ears on wrong?
results.creator_credit: Robert Phillip, David M. Thompson and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Rise of Modernism in Music 1890-1935”.
A profile of Charles Ives, one of America’s most important twentieth century composers, including interviews with composers Aaron Copland and Elliot Carter, performances by the Chilingirian String Quartet and BBC Symphony Orchestra, dramatised sequences of Ives childhood, an extract from Ives’ “Concord Sonata” played by John Kirkpatrick and filmed in Ives own studio.

results.title: Are girls calculating?
results.creator_credit: Diane O'Connor and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: This videotape can be used not only in the maths-science classroom to encourage girls to see the importance of maths, but also as a valuable resource for careers teachers, and for social science units on either the workforce or sexism in society.

results.title: Are drugs the answer?
results.brief_description: Dr. Cole, psychologist, and ex-student of Dr. Timothy Leary, leads a classroom discussion on the reasons for drug taking, informs on the three main categories of drugs, the need for education of young people and for criminal prosecution of drug dealers. The film was made with the co-operation of three U.S. high schools and their students. No other credits available.

results.title: Arctic thrills
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Adventure parade”.
Shows a sailing ship in the Novia Scotia, Arctic Circle area on the hunt to capture live polar bears to take back to the New York zoo as performing animals - “their reward for our arctic thrill”. Also includes some magnificent footage of icebergs and seal colonies. NB: Some scenes may distress, particularly the polar bear chase.

results.title: Arctic people
results.brief_description: This film shows without commentary how hunting is the traditional means of livelihood for the Eskimos in the barren Canadian northland. It also indicates how the less hostile environment of the low Arctic permits the Lapps to engage in husbandry and fishing. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Arctic outpost
results.creator_credit: John Feeney, Tom Daly and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Life at the small settlement of Pangnirtung on eastern Baffin Island, where there is as a Royal Canadian Mounted Police post, a Hudson’s Bay Company store, a mission hospital and a government school. The film presents on-the-spot accounts of the work of all of these. This is a shorter version of the film “Pangnirtung”.
